question: India's first centralised Air-Conditioned railway terminal is to come up in which city?
explanation:
Indiaâ€™s first centralised Air-Conditioned railway terminal at the city of Bengaluru is set to be operational soon.
It is named after one of the veteran civil engineer Bharat Ratna Sir M Visvesvaraya. The new coach terminal is planned at Baiyappanahalli in the city and is built at an estimated cost of Rs 314 crore.
